author: Grace Phillips
title: Youth Coding League Offers Inclusive STEM Education - DevX
text: In Independence, Oregon, a committed group of coders is assisting young learners in acquiring essential computer abilities and mastering coding through their involvement in the Youth Coding League. This national nonprofit organization was established to provide children with coding-related problem-solving and mathematical skills. The Youth Coding League offers various workshops, coding lessons, and after-school programs, designed to engage and excite kids about technology and the intricacies of computer software. The organization aims to close the digital divide by making these opportunities accessible to students across diverse socio-economic backgrounds and promoting inclusivity in STEM education. Funding and accessibility of the program The program, which operates from the [local](https://www.devx.com/enterprise/localization-in-business-how-to-build-a-strong-strategy/) public library, is supported by a $15,000 grant from the Oregon Community Foundations’ Thriving Entrepreneurs fund and is accessible to children at no cost. This initiative aims to provide young minds with the tools, resources, and mentorship they need to develop their entrepreneurial skills and foster innovative thinking. By removing the financial barrier, the library encourages participation from children of diverse socioeconomic backgrounds, enabling them to explore various [career paths](https://www.devx.com/uncategorized/is-technology-a-good-career-path-how-to-know-if-technology-is-the-right-career-path-for-you/) and opportunities. Current coding teams at the library At present, the library houses two coding teams: one for students in fifth and sixth grades, and another for those in seventh and eighth grades. These two teams provide age-appropriate guidance and challenges to help develop the students’ programming skills and [computational](https://www.devx.com/terms/computer/) thinking. Engaging in collaborative projects, members of each group benefit from the opportunity to learn from their peers while also having access to a wealth of library resources to advance their knowledge. Plans for expansion As plans to broaden the program are underway, an increasing number of children will have the chance to join these teams and hone their coding abilities. This expansion not only aims to create more opportunities for children to develop their coding skills, but also to foster a strong interest in technology from a young age. By cultivating this passion, the program endeavors to nurture a new generation of [innovative thinkers and problem solvers in the world of technology](https://www.devx.com/technology/recruitment-technology-innovation/). Preparing students for the future By offering valuable, practical learning experiences, the Youth Coding League aims to prepare upcoming generations with the necessary resources to thrive in the [digital](https://www.devx.com/terms/digitization/) era. The Youth Coding League not only equips young learners with coding skills but also fosters creativity, confidence, and problem-solving abilities. Through collaborative, hands-on projects, students gain exposure to real-world applications of technology, ensuring they are well-prepared for success in their future careers. Impact on the local community As the program expands, a greater number of children in Independence will benefit from this all-encompassing coding instruction. With the inclusion of more engaging and [interactive](https://www.devx.com/terms/interactivity/) lessons, these young minds will acquire essential coding skills that can significantly impact their future career opportunities. Furthermore, this initiative aims to foster a sense of curiosity and interest in technology, thereby supporting the growth of the local community’s [technological literacy](https://www.devx.com/technology/why-technology-literacy-is-so-important-for-modern-workers/). First Reported on: [statesmanjournal.com](https://www.statesmanjournal.com/story/news/local/2023/12/27/coding-team-independence-oregon/71833325007/) Frequently Asked Questions What is the Youth Coding League? The Youth Coding League is a national nonprofit organization in Independence, Oregon that aims to teach young students essential computer skills and coding through workshops, lessons, and after-school programs. Its mission is to promote inclusivity while [bridging](https://www.devx.com/terms/bridging/) the digital divide across socio-economic backgrounds. How is the program funded and how accessible is it to students? The program in Independence is funded by a $15,000 grant from the Oregon Community Foundations’ Thriving Entrepreneurs Fund. It is accessible for free to local children, allowing students from diverse socio-economic backgrounds to participate and develop their entrepreneurial skills and innovative thinking. What are the current coding teams available at the library? Currently, there are two coding teams at the library: one for students in fifth and sixth grades, and another for those in seventh and eighth grades. Each team provides age-appropriate guidance and challenges to develop students’ programming skills and computational thinking through collaboration and access to library resources. Are there any plans for expanding the program? Yes, plans to expand the program are being pursued to accommodate more children who want to join the teams and hone their coding skills. The expansion aims to foster a strong interest in technology and create opportunities for young learners to develop their coding abilities. How does the Youth Coding League prepare students for the future? The Youth Coding League offers valuable, practical learning [experiences that prepare future generations](https://www.devx.com/artificial-intelligence-ai/revolutionizing-search-a-glimpse-into-googles-generative-experience/) for the digital era. By teaching coding skills and fostering creativity, confidence, and problem-solving abilities, students gain exposure to real-world applications of technology, equipping them for success in their future careers. What is the impact of the program on the local community? As the program expands, more children in Independence will benefit from comprehensive coding instruction. The initiative aims to promote curiosity and interest in technology, enhance essential coding skills, and support the growth of technological literacy within the local community and its future workforce.
